content.description: Face climb to the bolt (crux) then follow the hand crack to exit. BYOA (build your own anchor). The hand crack section is a delight. I deferred to the rating given in K Keith's guide, but I thought that the crux (passing the bolt) was way harder than 5.4 Perhaps my hold selection skills were poor, but if this is 5.4 then Mr. Grinch is 5.8.
content.location: Far R side of Pavilion Wall. Scramble up and to the R of Mr. Grinch about 10 or 20 feet and find the single bolt and the hand crack at the top

content.description: Alternate start to Party Line. Climbs a thin seam off a boulder to the ledge, then continues up the unprotected face to finish up on the upper part of Party Line.
content.location: Thin seam above a boulder just right of Party Line.

content.description: Face climbing around a thin seam which takes small gear
content.location: Thin seam just to the left of Party Line Crack above a large boulder.

content.description: Climb up the small seam to the hand crack located in the middle of the roof.  Pull the roof and continue through easier terrain.   Finish through the chimney.  5.9+ variation - move right after the second bulge to a shallow finger crack.  Continue straight up the the anchor bolts. The crux is pulling the roof but is well protected.
content.protection: Single’s from .4 - #4.   Build an anchor at the top (5.9) or use the solid anchors above the 5.9+ finger crack variation.
content.location: Right in the middle of the roof on the left side of the wall.

content.description: Follow the bulges and discontinuous cracks to a black varnished slab.  Make several tenuous, no hands slab moves past two bolts to another horizontal crack.  Trust your rubber as you step your way up and over the final bulge to the top.  PG13 as the last bulge is protected by the horizontal crack below it.
content.protection: Singles to #3 and two quick draws.
content.location: Located in the middle of pavilion wall.  Look for the black varnished face.

content.description: A fun , right leaning, hand crack that starts about 1/3 of the way up the wall.  Follow along shallow discontinuous cracks and bulges to gain the start of the crack.
content.protection: Single set to BD #3.  Fixed anchors at the top but are about 15 feet back from the climb. Bring static line or cord to set up a top rop.
content.location: Located in the middle of the pavilion wall.  Easy walk off to climbers right to return to the base of the climb.

content.description: Face to chimney climbing. Start left and move up and right past boulder pile. Head up the face into the chimney and past a large chock stone.
content.location: Right side of wall. just above boulder pile.

climbs.name: Just South of Whoville (Whoville variant)
climbs.fa: ??? (route but not FA listed in Kevin Keith's 'Granite Dells Climbing Guide')

content.description: fun face slab directly between Whoville and Mr Grinch. an excellent place to practice easy half-rope belaying and climbing (the single bolt and unprotectable face makes the route very R if doing this on a single rope).
content.protection: 1 bolt... set an extended anchor in advance or top out and scramble back down. if you half-rope, you can wander back and forth to place pro in Mr. Grinch at Climber's left (hand and fist crack) and Whoville at climber's right (handcrack).  Halfroping takes the R safety all the way down to a G.
content.location: almost directly under the bolt at far right side of Pavilion Wall

content.description: Hard times climbs up the right side of the roof to a hand crack.  Follow the hand crack, through the bulges, straight up to a widening offwidth.  Use the shelf in the offwidth, or just grunt your way up for a satisfying finish. 5.9+ variation.  Step left after the second bulge and finish straight up through the finger crack to the anchors above.
content.protection: Singles up to a #4 BD.  Off width can probably protect with a #3 deep in the crack. Bring static line for setting up a TR.
content.location: Right side of the roof on the left side of the wall.

content.description: Wide crack that takes plenty of gear. crux is in the center with a tricky move even for a 5.5
content.location: Look for the large flaring crack near the center right of the wall.

content.description: This north facing wall has a couple of easy to moderate star quality face and crack climbs. Good rock. Bring draws and a standard rack, add a few long slings to rig an anchor on top. At times of high water the base is nearly in the lake.
